Array Without Local Maximumstime limit per test: 2 secondsmemory limit per test: 512 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard output Ivan unexpectedly saw a present from one of his previous birthdays. It is array of ùëõ numbers from 1 to 200. Array is old and some numbers are hard to read. Ivan remembers that for all elements at least one of its neighbours ls not less than it, more formally: ùëé1‚â§ùëé2, ùëéùëõ‚â§ùëéùëõ‚àí1 and ùëéùëñ‚â§ùëöùëéùë•(ùëéùëñ‚àí1,ùëéùëñ+1) for all ùëñ from 2 to ùëõ‚àí1. Ivan does not remember the array and asks to find the number of ways to restore it. Restored elements also should be integers from 1 to 200. Since the number of ways can be big, print it modulo 998244353. InputFirst line of input contains one integer ùëõ (2‚â§ùëõ‚â§105) ‚Äî size of the array. Second line of input contains ùëõ integers ùëéùëñ ‚Äî elements of array. Either ùëéùëñ=‚àí1 or 1‚â§ùëéùëñ‚â§200. ùëéùëñ=‚àí1 means that ùëñ-th element can‚Äôt be read. OutputPrint number of ways to restore the array modulo 998244353. Examplesinput3 1 -1 2output1input2 -1 -1output200NoteIn the first example, only possible value of ùëé2 is 2. In the second example, ùëé1=ùëé2 so there are 200 different values because all restored elements should be integers between 1 and 200. Solutiondp[i][j][k]Ë°®Á§∫ÂΩìÁ¨¨i‰∏™Êï∞‰∏∫jÔºåÁ¨¨i-1‰∏™Êï∞‰∏éÁ¨¨i‰∏™Êï∞‰πãÈó¥ÁöÑÂ§ßÂ∞èÂÖ≥Á≥ª‰∏∫kÊó∂ÁöÑÊñπÊ°àÊï∞ÁõÆ„ÄÇ (k = 0: a[i - 1] < a[i], k = 1: a[i - 1] = a[i], k = 2: a[i - 1] > a[i]) Áä∂ÊÄÅËΩ¨ÁßªÊñπÁ®ã dp[i][j][0] = $\sum_{x=1}^{j-1}$ (dp[i - 1][x][0] + dp[i - 1][x][1] + dp[i - 1][x][2]) dp[i][j][1] = dp[i - 1][j][0] + dp[i - 1][j][1] + dp[i - 1][j][2] dp[i][j][2] = $\sum_{x=j+1}^{200}$ (dp[i - 1][x][1] + dp[i - 1][x][2]) #include <bits/stdc++.h> using namespace std; typedef long long ll; const int maxn = 1e5 + 10; const int mod = 998244353; int n, a[maxn]; ll sum, dp[maxn][201][3]; inline const int read() { int x = 0, f = 1; char ch = getchar(); while (ch < '0' || ch > '9') { if (ch == '-') f = -1; ch = getchar(); } while (ch >= '0' && ch <= '9') { x = (x << 3) + (x << 1) + ch - '0'; ch = getchar(); } return x * f; } int main() { n = read(); for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) a[i] = read(); if (~a[1]) dp[1][a[1]][0] = 1; else for (int j = 1; j <= 200; j++) dp[1][j][0] = 1; for (int i = 2; i <= n; i++) { sum = 0; for (int j = 1; j <= 200; j++) { if (a[i] == -1 || a[i] == j) { dp[i][j][0] = sum; dp[i][j][1] = (dp[i - 1][j][0] + dp[i - 1][j][1] + dp[i - 1][j][2]) % mod; } sum = (sum + dp[i - 1][j][0] + dp[i - 1][j][1] + dp[i - 1][j][2]) % mod; } sum = 0; for (int j = 200; j >= 1; j--) { if (a[i] == -1 || a[i] == j) dp[i][j][2] = sum; sum = (sum + dp[i - 1][j][1] + dp[i - 1][j][2]) % mod; } } sum = 0; for (int j = 1; j <= 200; j++) sum = (sum + dp[n][j][1] + dp[n][j][2]) % mod; printf("%lld\n", sum); return 0; }
